name: Circular Package Dependency
description: You are analyzing package structures for circular dependencies. A violation occurs if Package A depends on Package B, and Package B (directly or indirectly) depends back on Package A. This creates tight coupling and makes the system hard to verify. Suggest applying the Dependency Inversion Principle (DIP) or extracting shared logic to a third common package.

remediation.quickFix: Extract shared code into a common package or use dependency inversion
remediation.explanation: Use interfaces and dependency inversion to break cycles. Consider the Dependency Inversion Principle (DIP).
